Comments_List: Statistical thinking, basics of probability, parametric and non-parametric tests, ANOVA, regression, some GLM, experimental design.

Great lectures, useful problem sets, video recording was helpful. I'm not sure why it was broken up into two halves; I felt like it could have continued as a big lecture course, since life-science specific stats don't seem all that specific, and life sciences are actually really broad.
Yes. It's a thorough introduction to statistics for someone with little or no stats, or in need of a refresher.
